posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52748590
Call of Legends is at the tail end of low print runs for pokemon cards. Card collecting was losing popularity during neo, and really lost popularity during e-series onward. Reflecting the lower sales, Pokemon lowered their print numbers to reflect lower demand. Low print numbers really start during Neo Destiny, and continued all the way through e-series, ex-series, and gen4 cards. The final set of gen4 was Call of Legends. A special set already, full of semi-reprints (new artwork but same attacks). It wasn't a failure, but it was just released as a small print run during a time when print runs were already tiny. I think Call of Legends may be one of the lowest printed around (along with things like ex doexys and skyridge). As a result, those Shiny Legend cards are among the rarest ultra rares around. If there ever is nostalgia and hype for those cards in the future, their prices could eclipse that of gold stars simply due to their rarity.

posts.com:
>>52749115
It's fun, sometimes. Playing it casually online or offline with friends is definitely fun, playing against tryhards and coomers is a different story.
You should start playing the solo mode on Master Duel to learn the game, maybe watch some short tutorials on YouTube about all forms of summoning, chaining, important rules of the game, just the basics. Once you get to understand the game mechanics, that's where the fun begins.
If you'd like to build your own deck, you'd be better off starting with 3x structure deck (most SDs have a portion of great cards, meh cards and not so great cards, just keep the best and other useful ones) and throwing in some staples. If you'd like to see if your deck is any good, download EDOpro (Project Ignis) and start fucking around with it, it's totally free and you can play with all cards. That are my 2 cents.
If you don't know how many times you have to put a certain card into your deck, just remember:
>3 times = card you want in your starting hand
>twice = important, but not necessary to start with, or cards you can easily search for
>once = it's a card you can easily search for or isn't that important for your engine
I'm currently playing a Kashtira deck and it's so much fun running that deck, unfortunately Fenrir and Unicorn will most likely become limited next year.
Have fun!

>>52769118
>follow me is ass
Yeah when runned without Draining Kiss or else you'll have no damage and be completely at the mercy of your team, Follow me is meant for you to charge in get the temporary tankiness from the shield and resistance buffs while taunting them close so you'll burst them with Draining Kiss(+ another shield when nearby allies) then run out and let your allies finish the job or wait for Follow Me to come back up and do the combo again to finish them off, if used with Rocky Helmet there are times you'll leave them so low you can just kill them with a boosted auto.
Follow Me helped me win so many 1v1/team fights that I thought I'll die in to end up killing my opponent because Follow Me buffed me enough to mitigate the attack that would've killed me otherwise.

If you don't like Follow Me, you can also run Draining Kiss with Gravity for zoning and a lot of damage whenever you trap them in your zone.

Moonlight+Follow Me is for people who wants to be pure Support, they don't care about damage they just want to keep the team alive and disrupt the enemy.

Second, I decided to add some little tables for Ranged vs Melee and noticed some things I never did before! Though that may just be because I'm dumb. Lastly I noticed that there are too fucking many fairy supporters. I can see why but christ. Give ideas for supporters that aren't fairy.

that's all from me this year, any suggestions for stuff to add to the spreadsheet are welcome! I'll see you all at EoS

>>52760148
I've seen some theories that Geeta might be Nemona's sister. I thought it was dumb at first, but I've actually become delusional enough to start believing it.
In Japanese, Geeta speaks like a fancy rich lady, which would fit with Nemona's family being rich. Nemona is one of the only people who has anything good to say about Geeta, which could be due to them being related. Similarly, Nemona seems to want Geeta's approval despite having already beaten Geeta in battle, which makes more sense if she looks up to Geeta as more than just a trainer.
Geeta also says how she's not used to seeing Nemona be so excited, which implies she's known Nemona long enough to have an idea of how she normally acts. Also Geeta calling Nemona to let her know you became a champion makes a lot more sense if they're close enough to talk outside of official situations.
I just think it would be really cool if the DLC focuses on both Nemona and Geeta, leading up to them revealing that they're both related.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52772458
First of all, you want a wooper outbreak since it's literally impossible otherwise. To force outbreaks to change you have to turn the switch clock 1 min behind every time, and a good way to increase (but not guarantee) the odds of a wooper outbreak to spawn is to eat a sandwich of the pokemon's type and to do the time change on a habitat it spawns (i went with ground and the swamp since it has less overlap)
You won't necessarily get the outbreak on the area you're doing this but you'll get it somewhere relevant. Try to avoid areas with too much water or that have very spread out outbreak spawns since they're a nightmare to work with.
After that, just do the old KO 60 outbreak pokemon, save, and then make a sparkling + humongo sandwich (see picrel) and pray for the best. Good luck soldier, it might take several attempts for a max size one (you can soft reset every time the sandwich is unsuccessful or the size isn't what you wanted to save on herba mystica; remember to turn auto save off so you don't lose the ingredients and to be able to savescum in front of the shiny in case the love ball fails)

I went with love ball for mine and I love her, she's not max size but she's right under the 255 size so it's good enough for me)

>>52761880
That's awesome it got you into online competitive battles!
Here's my wholehearted suggestion as someone who finally got a damn grasp of what everything means back in Gen 6, play to have fun.
Focus on using favorites and build around them, try a number of team building styles to see which works best for you. Me personally I'm a fan of balanced and hyper offensive teams. I'd avoid worrying about numbers and entirely avoid meta picking. It's fine if a mon you like ends up being a meta mon, but there's truly nothing more soulless than an entire team of copy/paste meta sets.

Me personally I have used a number of my favorites, built teams around them, tried new pokemon I've never touched before, made new favorites, and have accomplished breaking numerous top 500 tiers to varying degrees in both single and doubles across 3 generations.

Pokemon is about having fun catching and using those pokemon for battle. The mechanics aren't that difficult to teach, and I'd honestly extend the offer to teach you myself if you want a personal better understanding.

Despite the valid dissenters and those that have never played pokemon competitively about showdown, it's an excellent resource in trying new things on a dime without much commitment, so you find out what DOES work to then commit to it in game, which by the way has been made a billion times easier this generation compared to ones prior, an absolute massive win in my opinion!

If you'd like to know an omega powerful set with Polteageist, have a mon that is capable of setting up psychic terrain, have it faint or switch in on a prediction that involves you not getting hit (it's risky), make sure your polteageist has weak armor, a focus sash, and shell smash with stored power, shadow ball and a fairy coverage move for dark types, and you will have a borderline unkillable sweeper, the likes only other sashed mon can deal with or a scarfed ditto.
The psychic terrain helps out massively because it blocks ALL priority moves so you won't get gibbed by a revenge killer.

I dunno if the thread will be up by the time I get back tomorrow, I was about to head to bed in like 30, if you have Discord and would like to learn more neat tips, mechanics and the like, let me know, I'd be more than happy to help out.

If you can't tell, I'm really proud of these.

Only other M8 Champion besides Iris who >d-doesn't count because she's a main companion first and foremost to appear before the tournament, was a co-protagonist during the Arceus special, ended up getting all those flashbacks, canon loli Cynthia, canon teenage Cynthia, was the only Champion to take down the rat, only other Champion besides Ash who affected by the one gimmick ruleset, stayed on the tourney until the very end and last but not least Ash literally couldn't even believe he won whereas with everyone else his reaction was just generic and trite we won way pi-pikachu.
I think they were well aware enough of Cynthia's popularity and how she's viewed with most which is why all those things happened, and why such dubious choices like her throwing Stealth Rock 3/4 into the match when the only Pokemon on Ash's side resisted them, Garchomp's monodragon moveset when its last opponent is Mega Lucario and no Mega Garchomp happened. It leaves a big asterisk that makes you wonder "what if" one way or the other.
I think that considering the situation, how awful journeys writing was as a whole, and how the final boss had to be Leon because reasons, Cynthia came out rather well from this.

>>52725067
>What is the planned final version
Oh man that's a hard question to answer definitively because I'm making this up as I go. I started writing in July, posted the first playable version in September, and intended to release monthly updates as I add things and fix bugs. The game will be "complete" as of 1.3 in the sense that the story is finished, but I have a ton of secrets and side paths that I want to add, as well as some alternate options for endings. For example right now you can go to Jasmine's computer and find some material to blackmail her with, but I haven't yet added in an option to actually blackmail her or the scenes that would follow that. So I don't really know when the game with be 100% complete.

I've also had a handful of ideas where I had to stop myself and ask if they actually fit in this VN or if they'd be better off for a sequel and/or their own story. I'm not trying to cram every little possible thing into this VN, just the things that fit with the story.

here's an abstract idea: increase the level cap to 200.
what happens is speed tiers stay the exact same. but everything becomes more bulky comparatively.
you can already see level 50 formats cause 100-110% damage moves to go up to 110-120 or so. with everything bulkier, the speed stat's importance for moving first in the only damage exchange most mons partake in, will be diminished. it will be more frequent for bulky offense to survive a hit and 1hk in return, essentially.

>>52762566
Make it so that Pokemon attacks land simultaneously, but resolve according to the speed order. So a slower Pokemon can still get its attack in even if it faints that turn.

Additionally, there should be a damage nerf or HP buff across the whole game so that OHKOs are much rarer. Pokemon 1v1 matchups shouldn't be over in a single turn.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52762566
Speed is fundamentally different to other stats because it's the only one where 1 point actually matters, hence why speed creep is such a blatant thing, with mons getting literally 1 point of speed more than previous meta threats.
But because of damage rolls, damage has a 15% variation, meaning that you need to invest way more into your bulk stats to go from a guaranteed OHKO to a guaranteed 2HKO. That goes for attackers and defenders.

Just remove damage rolls, and suddenly bulk and power become a lot more meaningful because you can EV to specifically KO or survive certain things far more consistently.

>>52772160
Not only do Charizard and Typhlosion have the same base stats, but so do their pre-evolutions. And this actually makes perfect sense.
Charmander is based on a salamander, and Cyndaquil is based on a hinezumi.
The mythical salamander being just like the real salamander, except it lives in fire and also consumes fire by walking through it.
The hinezumi is a mouse/rat yokai that lives in fire and also consumes fire by walking through it.

They're basically the same mythical creatures but from different cultures, hence the lines having the same stats.

Now for the problem with the Koraidon and Miraidon have to be that they don't really have lore or significant part (until the final chapter) in the story. Hell, almost no one knows who they are.

The Winged King being strong enough to causes earthquake and splitting the land in half, while the Iron Serpent is powerful enough to turn the land into ash with lightning. The third legendary could only create two due to it trying to make them true to their own lore and could only make two possible because itself is trapped and weaken while the other paradox are not as powerful as the Raidon, causing it to create as many.

TL;DR Third legendary make fake pokemon into reality while giving them the power of legendaries.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52771667
Going best friends with someone is a pain if you can't co-ordinate lucky eggs. If it's someone you know in person or can contact in a online group for local players it's fine.

It's not worth stressing over though, since the XP rework, a 200k XP haul from a lucky egg'd best friend is the equivalent of catching 170~ Pokémon with a first-throw excellent curveball. (1170 XP).

The best use of a lucky egg these days is for XP boosting events like community days with 3x XP.
With lucky egg active, excellent curveball catches are going to yield about 7k XP each. You can earn over 1m XP in about 142 catches, which you can probably do with maybe two lucky eggs in an hour.

Mass-evolving Pokémon during a 2x evolution XP spotlight hour isn't a bad idea either. You can evolve about 80 Pokémon in 30 minutes, and get 320k XP from that. The point being these are optimal times to co-ordinate lucky eggs, using one just for the best friend yield alone is a little wasteful.
Doing multiple best/ultra friends at once though? That's worth doing.

>>52753422
Because fire/fighting is a decent defensive typing, it's defense stats aren't bad at all, it can hit hard enough without attack investment, it has intimidate to nueter physical attackers, and it also has Will O Wisp to screw them up even further. With the meta as hyper offense focused as it is now,these are all good traits to have. Also, there isn't any fire/fighting competition, but even if there were, none of them are very good defensively because of shitty defense stats. So it'll always have a niche.

Honestly, it's extremely underrated. I don't see it being OU honestly, but it's a solid UU mon.

>>52769427
>hax but stronger
lmao no.
baxcalibur lacks the coverage to answer to its counters, sure it can never get burned, but so can a lum berry on hax, and that's more for the flexibility of potential status or confusion

Haxorus has done wonders for me, and on a few occassions, soloing entire teams. Max attack, max speed, adamant nature, mold breaker with a lum berry, outrage, earthquake, poison jab, and d-dance is an extremely effective set that crushes just about everything it comes across.

The things holding baxcalibur back is the lack of coverage for its checks and its ice typing defensively.

Maushold has better utility with tidy up by far, but does not have the same answers and variety of moves that work with its ability like cinccino does. Population bomb isn't gonna do shit to a ghost, bullet seed less so if it has a resistant dual type. If maushold didn't have tidy up it probably would be significantly worse overall.

Garganacl is just the first time a rock type has ever been good. The one thing that has always been insufferable about rock types is their lack of sustain for their potential bulk, as often they have terrible defensive dual typings and are generally slow. More rock types need recovery moves of their own to even compare.

Mawile as a base pokemon in comparison to tinkaton, obviously tinkaton is better, but if you're comparing overall potential, mawile's mega is extremely invaluable, especially in doubles.

The only thing Orthworm has over steelix is ground immunity and shed tail, otherwise it's statistically worse defensively across both stats.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52772355
Not her but there aren't any overt shogi references in their Japanese names outside of possibly Pawniard's name Komatana. Koma is a word for a shogi piece, but Komatana could just as easily be derived from the word koma which means precise. Komagiri is to slice something into fine pieces and kogatana is a knife. Bisharp's Japanese name is just a pun about slicing stuff, and Kingambit's Japanese name is about slicing stuff and prostration.

>>52766187
To me, the island trial always seemed to be presented as tougher than the regular gym challenge. Less prestigious for sure since it is an old tradition for some backwater island chain but compared to gym leaders, who are just there for sport and are chosen by committee, captains and kahunas actually held some degree of authority over their islands and are expected to perform accordingly, protecting the people and pokemon from the wrath of the local gods and the aliens regularly invading the place. Not to mention the games are littered with people talking about how they failed the trials or how strong the captains are, as opposed to all the random trainers you fight in other games who boast about defeating the local gym leaders.

This thread is for the growth of artists and those who draw for fun. If you're going to give critique, please do it constructively. Rude or blunt critiques won't help anybody.

Requesters are free to request what they wish, but avoid bumping your request every half hour as it's only going to put people off; try giving it a few hours or more.

Please provide references in ONE image, especially when requesting something outside of the Pokémon universe. If you request something from the old Drawthread or a separate thread, COPY & PASTE the actual request instead of posting a link.

Also, be mindful that requests are done at the discretion of the artists, not on a first come first serve basis.

Please remember to save any piece of art you like from these threads, as we may never know when the archive will start deleting images again. Artists can and are recommended to post their works on other outlets for archival purposes.

>>52771130
None of them, while i can get some enjoyment; they're just varying levels of incompetent. Pokemon is notably unique mechanically but this does not excuse it avoiding the stuff it blatantly does have reference for.
Gen 3 came with some awful design choices that made Hoenn already kinda wonky but Servii is very obviously just bland messes they need so they can slap anything that could actually impact the main game on random islands.
And the moltres thing, but Mt. Ember suffers from being a gen 3 dungeon but without a gimmick; which is what they heavily relied on in the gen.

Gen 3 didn't really look great, its newest addition while great like the last is kinda flimsy ingame like most gamefreak additions. FRLG also suffers from not exactly great music most of the time(but its not a gen 3 wide issue).
Ingame trainers aren't really much of an improvement from that last; though gamefreak never really hit a stride with those so its a minor point. Natures are horrific from an ingame perspective(because negative attack is painful as hell).
EVs theoretically could sit in this but since its never interacted with it doesn't matter.

>>52771249

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52771266
Probably gen 2? Just mostly a nice clean experience that feels mostly distinctive to me.
But the tumorous growth on its ass end and just having some bad choices does make it feel like a really iffy option to me.

I'm also somewhat inclined towards gen 4, and not for HGSS because i don't actually think HGSS for all its praise exactly improves on the actual game much. Doesn't look that much better really, its mostly meme gimmicks.
Sinnoh is pretty interesting but i recall some notable stretches of nothing.

Gen 5 feels like Gen 3 2 to me, and i honestly don't like that overall feel; what its generally praised for don't really hold up for me.
There's random chunks of Kalos i sorta like, but so much of the region is a blur. I can appreciate chunks of SM but it sucks to playthrough, and feels like it kinda just becomes a load of nothing by the end.
Galar was just bland, i really don't think i'd ever want to touch gen 8 again since it didn't really give me much of anything. Lets go ironically did have more interesting ideas, but is bogged down even harder than SM; including by outright fucking mechanics.
Legends was an okay tech demo but doesn't really feel like a full game. SV has bursts of interest but mostly feels like a sister game being very tech demoish.
But now with even less care in regards to performance, it feels like its literally an incomplete "buy the next game to get a proper version of this concept".

>>52771160
Stop trying to deflect your inanity towards me, young man. The fact that you people can't understand the basic blocks of fictions should give pause to your statement. I don't find pleasure over this. in fact I've grown to find it even more icky than before. Realizing that Pokémon share the space of innocent natural creatures, to learn that their construction and attitudes mirror that of dogs and cats by choice and reading all these perverted posts is enough to give any decent person pause.

The issues isn't consent or that they're sexually active, the issue is that Pokémon don't occupy the space for it to be right. Pokémon are creatures that are treated like cats and dogs, that have the attitude of cats and dogs and are also creatures that occupy that space in-universe. They don't occupy the space of being people. These are creatures that eat dry food out of a dog bowl, that exhibit zoomies when excited and they also chew on shoes, these are creatures that simply want to be friends with you like a dog wants to be friends with a person. They're deliberately constructed to mirror creatures that are naturally affectionate towards humans in the real world and I bet many people can see that. It's a big part as to why Pokémon resonate strongly with people in the real world, despite being fantasy critters we can see how they reflect creatures from the real world. This becomes very apparent from reading the product guide from 2010 because TPC set guidelines up to safeguard this construction from 3rd parties.

In short Pokémon are not people, they're not human so we shouldn't impose anything on them. People here need to be honest with themselves and just admit they want to have these icky fantasies with critters that follow orders and are socially subordinate to their trainers who also have the mannerisms and thought process of dogs. No ones owes you to play into these delusions and mirages, let's be honest with ourselves without sugarcoating.

>>52717546
Starmie is really nasty, it has a +22.5% crit rate with Bubblebeam for an effective power of 65*1.5*1.8= 175bp off of 100 Special.

In RBY criticals don't do double damage, rather it's level dependent multiplier of (2*Lv+5)/(Lv+5). That means a Level 2 Rattata on Route 1 getting a critical only hits for 1.28 times damage.
I actually kind of like that, it makes the early game much less volatile, no one hit kills on an unlucky critical. And it's not like it affect competitive much since at 50 the multiplier is 1.9 and at 100 it's 1.95.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Hey friends, I've been wanting to relive the days when I actually enjoyed this fucking series, so I figured I'd do a Nuzlocke challenge like the good old days. Gonna play the era I enjoy, GBA/DS. Sort of a region-travel playthrough. FireRed, SoulSilver, Emerald, Platinum, and White.

Rules aside from the normal:
>Champion Clause: Any Pokemon, living or dead, that makes it to the HoF in one game has its line stricken from all subsequent ones. This includes split evos like Eevees or Hitmons.
>Set battle style
>Wild Pokemon and Starters randomized to within the same power level to make catches actually somewhat interesting in regions with poorly-distributed Regional Dexes

Starting off with a choice of Totodile, Pichu, or Ralts with Brock as my first gym leader makes things easy, though it does unfortunately give Boomer's rival, Zoomer, what he called "an easy dub no cap fr fr" with a two-shot Thundershock. Thankfully, I don't consider the Nuzlocke to start until after Rival 1, so here we go!

Time for Brassius. Decided to put Ember on YankeeDoodle again, Sudowoodo might take more from that than Flame Charge.
>Vs Brassius
>Petilil
Two Flame Charges make quick work of it. YankeeDoodle barely feels the Mega Drain inbetween.
>Smoliv
Two Flame Charges are once again enough. The Tackle inbetween doesn't do much.
>Truleewoodo
I'm well aware a Rock Throw is coming, so I have YankeeDoodle terastalize into a Normal type.
Ember does less than a third to the Gym Leader's ace. Rock Throw does fairly big damage even with the weakness removed.
Flame Charge does about the same as Ember- I won't be able to take out Truleewoodo with another one, and with Trailblaze leaving YankeeDoodle at only 5 HP, I have to switch out.
I swap in Jock McGraw, but Trailblaze does well over half. I take what damage I can with Fake Out before switching out again. I go for Douce Dame, who takes Trailblaze with no issue. Two Ice Shards finishes off the fight, even if Rock Throw does some nasty damage.

posts.com:
It's that time of the year again, welcome to the /vp/ Monotype Tournament!

Put together a gym leader style team and battle it out in the Monotype tournament where you fight to win a gym leader spot and represent your favorite type in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet!

Rules and details: https://pastebin.com/VEH2MVZ0

Tournament starts on the 27th of December.

Need to practice, team-build, or get some breeding leftovers to help you prepare for the tournament? Post away! There's plenty of people around to help!

All communications will be conducted within discord once the tournament begins.

>>52742630
His opinion does matter because he would be familiar with the creation process. He's one of the key founders of the Pokémon series and he's basically right. Look at the video posted, the girl speaks of Pokémon as if she was talking about dogs and the scenes shown in the video show how Pokémon even act like obedient dogs. Why would Gengar wait 3 years for it's owner instead of acting like it states on the dex? Why did it act like an obedient dog rather than the scary monster it's described in the pokedex? The anime even shows Gengar eating dry food like a dog, clearly not a scary monster as in the dex but a creature that's closer to a dog more than anything. The dex can serve as a cool backstory and play a role but depiction takes precedent over it and depicting Pokémon as cute and innocent critters is foremost more important than anything else hence why the Pokémon company is very anal about depiction of Pokemon and very meticulous in the way they're depicted.

And what you mention is common in all media.
https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TalkingAnimal
https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IntellectualAnimal
None of the characters listed stop being animals/pets just because of their abilities, they're still constructed to be pets/animals. Snoopy may be able to write a novel but he's still very much Charlie Brown's dog in the way he's treated and acts. Likewise we know the same with Pokémon because of Tajiri's statements and even statements from The Pokémon Company. This is why Pokémon share universal pet behaviors like zoomies or chewing on shoes like in HGSS or as why the player bathes and cleans them like one does their pet, this implies Pokémon can't clean themselves, or as to why we see things like pet beds in Scarlet and Violet. The games and anime are constructing Pokémon as cats and dogs despite their fantastical nature and we have statements proving it's deliberate.

Things like that play big role in reception to PKMN

I fail to see how it's irrelevant because Pokémon doesn't exist in a vacum. You live in a world where apparently these things dislodge Pokémon from their intended space which they don't. Not only do you chose to ignore actual words from the people who run the series but also the many ways in which the series chooses to contextualize Pokémon. Nothing in Pokémon Snap ending suggest the girl is naive, verily so the point of Pokémon being attuned to the feelings of people and showing trust and love when shown love by people was a major point in Legends of Arceus such as NPCs remarking on the love the MC has for their Pokémon and even the lady at the pasture proclaiming Pokémon must want to be friendly with people since they're not running away from the pastures. Also it's never implied that the gengar bonded with it's trainer, instead it's revealed the trainer started to detest the gengar nevertheless it chose to be a good boy and await for it's owner. Likewise many abandoned Pokémon, like Ash charmender chose to wait for their owner and in Charmander case even if it meant death and enduring more abuse. The reception to the Gengar episode among children was one of sadness, many proclaimed to have cried at it's backstory because it has an element of pet innocence to it, indeed one reddit post called it the jurassic bark of Pokémon.

With all that in mind this construction is very powerful to the point that it greatly influences reception to Pokémon even in the NSFW sphere and as to why so many people have issues with sexualization of any Pokémon, they act cute and innocent and many people perceive Pokémon as occupying the space of critters in universe, and not just any critter but also the space of cats and dogs.

Of course I'm not alone here, as I mentioned you see this perception every on mass media. But as an example a rolling stone article for detective pikachu states that "Pokémon are like dogs" and that the movie is a "dog movie".

First I show other examples to show how Pokémon doesn't exist in isolation. The points brought up does not change the construction of Pokémon which is not only openly apparent to anyone who isn't clouded by their sentiments but also backed up by the very people who work on the series. To deny this is to be ignorant of the most basic foundations of fiction. Pokémon occupy a space in a very deliberate manner.

And no, their words have not been proven wrong given how they are constructing Pokémon to this very day. You are equating basic anthropomorphism as a means to deny the space Pokémon occupy which doesn't work because of how the series is set up. Just as my example with Snoopy, the dog can write a novel but the series contextualizes him as being Charlie Brown's dog, he's not a person that lives in a house and pays taxes. He's a dog that lives in a dog house and eats dog food.

The point of the video was to showcase how much affection Pokémon have towards people even when facing abuse. Pokémon, much like dogs, crave attention from people and want to be friends with people, that is in the sense one is with their pet. It manifest to the point that Pokémon do not harm their owners, they still obey them and also still want to be with them. Much as in real life people abuse dog despite their natural affection towards people.

From Legends of Arceus:
>I guess Pokémon must get friendly with people because they really want to. If they didn’t, they’d probably just escape the pastures and run.[VAR 0114(0071)]

From Dr. Footstep:
>"<player> is... A remarkable human and Trainer. That I can always perform the best any <Pokémon> possibly can... I attribute that entirely to my partner <player>. When we travel, I can see wild Pokémon eyeing us enviously..."
>"There are no Pokémon that dislike humans... Only humans that dislike Pokémon... We <Pokémon> are especially shunned... But <player> always treats me as a friend and partner..."

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52764991
These quotes imply that even wild Pokémon feel jealousy towards domesticated Pokémon but also that naturally Pokémon are creatures that want to bond with humans just as domesticated dogs in the real world. The ending for New Pokémon Snap isn't a girl being naive, the game never paints her like that, but her simply pointing out how Pokémon are by their nature which goes back to what Tajiri described Pokémon as, creatures that are like cats and dogs.

And of course it's not "schizo babble" as you put it. Those are examples from social media that showcase how this construction manifests itself in the perception of Pokémon as creatures.

Tweets like this:
https://mobile.twitter.com/ShitpostGate/status/1592319612800364545

Even fan made videos like Select your Partner, furrymon and the batman Joker meme showcase how prevalent the view point of Pokémon as critters is. The YouTuber Dr. Lando, who made a meme video about Pokémon attraction that blew up, clearly viewed Pokémon as critters as in one of his videos he put Pokémon outside of. being monsters. These are but a few examples but the perception is clearly there so much that it has a big impact on reception to Pokémon designs.

>>52750129
I doubt she was meant as a one-off, I think she was meant to be Crystal. Her original name was Nanako, which lines up in terms of
RGBY - 1,2,3,4
GS - 5,6
so if the anime writers were anticipating a third game for gen 2, it would've been the 7th name. Of course, they didn't know what the next games would be called, hence "Nanako". (Compare to the manga where the writer was expecting a third version for Gen 4, but since he didn't know the name of the game, he instead called the character "Lady Berlitz" and revealed her name as "Platinum" only when he found out the name of the third game.)

She does look vaguely like Kris, but desu there are characters of the day in the anime who look even more like Kris so it's coincidental imo

I did my first proper shiny hunt in Violet today, a Charcadet outbreak.
No herba mystica or shiny charm yet, I need to finish post-game and mass duplicate some ability patches because I'm still on 1.0.1 and cannot trade until I update.

They spawned in a favourable location that was easy to run back and forth in and with 1 in 1366 odds caught three shinies in the course of maybe 4-5 hours on and off.
The hard part was spotting them, the only difference is the blue eyes, so there was a bunch of approaching them to get them to turn towards me.

I caught them in a luxury ball (female), love ball (female), and poké ball (male).
The male was modest, so that one I'll evolve into Armarouge.

posts.com:
>>52767685
Only the first three. But this one had to be finished up by Yuyama because Shudo fell extremely ill.

The stinger is that Shudo gave the movie to Yuyama to finish because he was the only other senior staff member with a daughter and so he thought he'd understand the story he was trying to tell (the 3rd movie is Shudo working through his feelings about his then newborn daughter and how her parents were in their fifties when they had her). It was one of the breaking point of him leaving the show. He originally wanted the third movie to answer the question of what happened to real life animals and the revival of a T Rex. However, he didn't get much info on the gen 2 Pokemon and the few he did were only images which is why unown here doesn't match unown in gen 2 pokedex entries.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52767991
Regional professor sends you video calls from the Big Magic Hole in the center of the region.
Regional professor is also the mom/dad to one of the main story NPCs who basically ran off to do science in the Big Magic Hole
When you go to the Big Magic Hole at the end of the game, professor's been dead a long time and you're being led around by the a robot that looks like the professor/ has their memories.
Big Magic Hole has a "time machine" in a giant magic crystal room that also leaks magic crystal energy into robo-professor.
Big Magic Hole "time machine" is allegedly summoning pokemon from the past/future, but these pokemon's designs can be found in a notebook that the professor was obsessed with.
Frequent allusions to the past/future being the late professor's "dream."
Sorry if I'm doing a piss poor job of summarizing. It's a weird endplot.

>Was having the same protagonist throughout all of the regions a bad idea from the start?
Yes. Ash was always a bad protagonist to begin with (being uniquely incompetent and often winning just with sheer luck or some other nonsense while not even knowing type matchups) but keeping him for 20+ forced the series into permanent stagnation where Ash kept losing, his power level and team got reset when he entered a new region and the cycle of stagnation continued. Finally the writers dropped the ball so hard with the ending of Gen VI anime that they had to make Ash win two tournaments in a row, become le strongest ever as an apology and then finally retire him. Just awful.

The fact is that Ash was always the issue since the main series anime was always the worst of the Pokemon anime series. Literally all spin-off series are better, whether it's Origins or Generations or something else. All of those have been well received by the fanbase. Ashnime has always been the issue and it was about time that it's finally put to rest.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52766756
The moment they made the announcement to change protagonists, yes, it retroactively became a bad idea from the start. Ash and Pikachu staying in the spotlight was a great idea for the brand and a terrible idea for the show's quality. Now him having been the protagonist for that long is just a bad idea flat out but at the rate they were going they were just stuck between a rock and a hard place.

I know a lot of people wanted Gen 6 to be the end, but Gen 6 was just an apology tour for Gen 5, then the end of Gen 7 and the entirety of Gen 8 were just apology tours for the end of Gen 6. Gen 5 was the breaking point where they reset the character to incompetency but did not reset his endearing sassiness and attitude. The time to drop him was Gen 2, with Gen 4 being the actual last chance to have it feel natural at all.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52766756
Like any story idea, the idea itself usually isn't the issue. It's how they handled/executed it.

There's two halves of the Pokemon anime that need to be looked at here. The "plot" (such as it were), and the actual content (that is, the filler, which is like 70% of the show). People who complain that nothing ever happens in the anime and wish it was more like Adventures or whatever need to just stop the conversation here. That's never going to happen because their primary audience is still the primary school kids.

That being said, they still screwed up both halves of the show in varying degrees. Ash's reset in BW and then subsequent lack of character (or at least, huge character inconsistencies) have been well-documented already. It makes it hard to follow Ash as a continuous character, which wouldn't be a problem if not for the second point:

The fillers are largely completely boring wastes of time. I don't know what it is, but there's maybe one episode worth watching every half a year or so of the show's run. There's usually no heart to the show even as a simple kid's show. Go back to Doraemon for example. Usually every episode Nobita gets a new gadget (so the direct comparison would be a new Pokemon) because he's bullied at school again or whatever and he wants a quick fix, shenanigans ensue and generally Nobita learns a lesson by the end of the episode. Compare that to a random Pokemon filler like Ash and Goh running into Falinks. The episode is basically about them teaching Falinks how to work together as a team better. Okay, good start. So how about having a plot where Ash/Goh argue over how they can achieve that, then the end of episode Ash and Goh also learn something about teamwork? That's like the most bare minimum basic idea for an episode and they didn't even do that, so the episode ends up being about "look at this new Pokemon" and not much else.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Hard reboots are necessary if you're going to use the same character for decades. Otherwise you're stuck with a character with way too much baggage that a rotating door audience can't relate to.
Little kids are the main audience and they're constantly growing out of Pokemon. Then a new audience of children is shuffled in.
They should have done like other franchises if they wanted to keep Ash for 30 more years. OS Ash should've been one unique character. Gen 3 Ash another. Gen 4 ash, etc.
They tried this with the AU Ash we keep seeing, but little kids don't care for that either. The truth is most people are just sick and tired of Ash.
Most kids don't care about the human characters, they just want to see Pokemon being cool or cute. Ash was in the way of that and I think TPC learned this finally. New characters bring new ace Pokemon and new toys. The anime doesn't need to be good. It just needs to market toys.
